comment: FYI . Inuit are NOT part of First Nations , we do not have tribes and don't live on reservations . Inuit means " People " , we are people of the North . Inuk is singular for a member of the Inuit . And please don't say Inuit people , you're saying people people when you say that .
amr:
# ::snt FYI . Inuit are NOT part of First Nations , we do not have tribes and don't live on reservations . Inuit means " People " , we are people of the North . Inuk is singular for a member of the Inuit . And please don't say Inuit people , you're saying people people when you say that .
(m / multi-sentence
      :snt1 (ii / inform-01
            :ARG1 (y / you)
            :ARG2 (h / have-part-91
                  :polarity -
                  :ARG1 (n / nation
                        :mod (f / first))
                  :ARG2 (p / person
                        :mod (e / ethnic-group
                              :name (n2 / name
                                    :op1 "Inuit")))))
      :snt2 (a / and
            :op1 (h2 / have-03
                  :polarity -
                  :ARG0 (w / we)
                  :ARG1 (t / tribe))
            :op2 (l / live-01
                  :polarity -
                  :ARG0 w
                  :location (r / reservation)))
      :snt3 (m2 / mean-01
            :ARG1 (p2 / person
                  :mod (n3 / north))
            :ARG2 (p3 / person
                  :mod (e2 / ethnic-group
                        :name (n4 / name
                              :op1 "Inuit"))))
      :snt4 (s / singular
            :domain (p4 / person
                  :ARG0-of (h3 / have-org-role-91
                        :ARG1 (e3 / ethnic-group
                              :name (n5 / name
                                    :op1 "Inuit"))
                        :ARG2 (m3 / member))))
      :snt5 (a2 / and
            :op2 (s2 / say-01
                  :mode imperative
                  :polite +
                  :ARG0 (y2 / you)
                  :ARG1 (p5 / person
                        :mod e2)
                  :time (s3 / say-01
                        :ARG0 y2
                        :ARG1 (t2 / that)))))

comment: Sooooo ... that means I'm " Inuit " too . And as a " people " I got better things to do than be a language snob and a bully because people don't know the finer points of a virtually dead language .

(m / multi-sentence

            :ARG1 (t / that)
            :ARG2 (p / person
                  :mod (e / ethnic-group
                        :name (n / name
                              :op1 "Inuit"))
                  :domain (ii / i)
                  :mod (t2 / too)))
      :snt2 (a / and

                  :ARG0 (k / know-01

                        :ARG0 (p2 / person)
                        :ARG1 (p3 / point
                              :ARG1-of (h / have-degree-91
                                    :ARG2 (f / fine-03
                                          :ARG1 p3)
                                    :ARG3 (m3 / more)
                                    :ARG4 (a2 / and
                                          :op1 (s / snob
                                                :mod (l / language))
                                          :op2 (b / bully-01)))))
                  :ARG1 h
                  :ARG1 (t3 / thing

                  :ARG2 (g / good-02
                        :ARG1 t3)
                  :ARG3 m3)
            :ARG4 a2)
      :condition (p4 / person
            :domain ii2))

comment: Not even close to the main point here , but Inuktitut is not even close to " virtually dead " . the overwhelming majority of Inuit in Nunavut speak it as a first language and a large number speak it at home . speakers also have better age distribution than many endangered languages .
amr:
# ::snt Not even close to the main point here , but Inuktitut is not even close to " virtually dead " . the overwhelming majority of Inuit in Nunavut speak it as a first language and a large number speak it at home . speakers also have better age distribution than many endangered languages .
(m / multi-sentence
      :snt1 (c / close-10
            :polarity -
            :ARG1 (l / local-region
                  :name (n / name
                        :op1 "Inuktitut"))
            :ARG2 (p / point
                  :mod (m2 / main)
                  :location (h / here))
            :mod (e / even))
      :snt2 (c2 / close-10
            :polarity -
            :ARG1 l
            :ARG2 (d / die-01
                  :mod (v / virtual))
            :mod (e2 / even))
      :snt3 (a / and
            :op1 (s / speak-01
                  :ARG0 (m3 / majority
                        :ARG2-of (ii / include-91
                              :ARG1 (p2 / person
                                    :mod (e3 / ethnic-group
                                          :name (n2 / name
                                                :op1 "Inuit"))))
                        :ARG0-of (o / overwhelm-01)
                        :location (p3 / province
                              :name (n3 / name
                                    :op1 "Nunavut")))
                  :ARG3 (l2 / language
                        :ord (o2 / ordinal-entity
                              :value 1)))
            :op2 (s2 / speak-01
                  :ARG0 (p4 / person
                        :quant (n4 / number
                              :mod (l3 / large)))
                  :ARG3 l2
                  :location (h2 / home)))
      :snt4 (h3 / have-03
            :ARG0 (p5 / person
                  :ARG0-of (s3 / speak-01))
            :ARG1 (d2 / distribute-01
                  :ARG1 (a2 / age)
                  :ARG1-of (h4 / have-degree-91
                        :ARG2 (g / good-02)
                        :ARG3 (m4 / more)
                        :ARG4 (l4 / language
                              :quant (m5 / many)
                              :ARG1-of (e4 / endanger-01))))
            :mod (a3 / also)))

comment: I don't know what you mean by " word count " but if this is how you see the world we can't have a productive discussion . Consider that some people might not want to be white Americans who only speak one language and tsk-tsk at people who have the nerve to have a vernacular .
